analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena  cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho

analyzed: ñāṇam dhammaḥ ñāta ṭṭhaḥ atthaḥ

analyzed: paññā dhammaḥ pajānanaṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Understanding is the Dhamma; the meaning of penetration is the meaning.

analyzed: vijjā dhammo paṭivedha aṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Clear vision is the Dhamma; the meaning of penetration is the meaning.

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Light is the Dhamma; the meaning of illumination is the meaning.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā dukkhavatthukā saccavatthukā saccārammaṇā saccagocarā saccasaṅgahitā saccapariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā dukkha vatthukā sacca vatthukā sacca ārammaṇā sacca gocarā sacca saṅgahitā sacca pariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā
translated: These five dhammas, five meanings, are based on suffering, are based on the truths, have the truths as their object, have the truths as their domain, are included in the truths, are encompassed by the truths, have arisen from the truths, are firmly based on the truths, are well based on the truths.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka  dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: “Wheel of the Dhamma”: in what sense is it a wheel of the Dhamma?🔽It sets in motion the Dhamma and it is a wheel, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti  dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It sets in motion a wheel and it is the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It is set in motion by the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It is set in motion by the practice of the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It is set in motion by one who is established in the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme patiṭṭhāpento pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme vasi patto
translated: It is set in motion by one who is firmly based in the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It is set in motion by one who establishes others in the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It is set in motion by one who has attained mastery in the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme vasim pāpentaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It is set in motion by one who makes others attain mastery in the Dhamma, thus it is a wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme pārami patto pavatteti iti dhammacakka

analyzed: saddhi indriyam tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka

original: Vīriyindriyaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Satindriyaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.

original: Samādhindriyaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Paññindriyaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: samādhi indriyam tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  paññindriyam tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The faculty of concentration is a state that leads to emergence: it is the wheel of Dhamma.🔽The faculty of wisdom is a state that leads to emergence: it is the wheel of Dhamma.

original: Saddhābalaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Vīriyabalaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.

translated: The strength of faith is a state that leads to emergence: it is the wheel of Dhamma.🔽The strength of energy is a state that leads to emergence: it is the wheel of Dhamma.

analyzed: sammā avāyāmaḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Right effort is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.

original: Sammāsati dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Sammāsamādhi dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: sammā sati dhammaḥ tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  sammāsamādhi dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Right mindfulness is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.🔽Right concentration is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.

original: Ādhipateyyaṭṭhena indriyaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Akampiyaṭṭhena balaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Niyyānikaṭṭhena bojjhaṅgo dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: ādhipateyya ṭṭhena indriyam tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  a kampiya ṭṭhena balam dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  niyyānika ṭṭhena bojjhaṅgaḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The faculty of faith is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.🔽The power of faith is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.🔽The enlightenment factor of mindfulness is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.

original: Hetuṭṭhena maggo dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena satipaṭṭhānā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Padahanaṭṭhena sammappadhānā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: hetu ṭṭhena maggaḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sati paṭṭhānā dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  padahana ṭṭhena sammappadhānāḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The path is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.🔽The foundation of mindfulness is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.🔽Right endeavour is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.

original: Ijjhanaṭṭhena iddhipādā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: iddhipādāḥ tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The basis for spiritual power is a state that leads to that state: this is the wheel.

original: Tathaṭṭhena saccā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Avikkhepaṭṭhena samatho dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: tathaṭṭhena saccā dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  avikkhepa ṭṭhena samathaḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The Dhamma is the truth in the sense of the way things are. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽Tranquillity is the Dhamma in the sense of non-distraction. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Anupassanaṭṭhena vipassanā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Ekarasaṭṭhena samathavipassanā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: anupassana ṭṭhena vipassanā dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  ekarasa ṭṭhena samatha vipassanā dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Insight is the Dhamma in the sense of contemplation. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽Serenity and insight are the Dhamma in the sense of single function. They set that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Anativattanaṭṭhena yuganaddhaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Saṁvaraṭṭhena sīlavisuddhi dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: an ativattana ṭṭhena yuga naddham dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  savaraṭṭhena sīla visuddhi dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: The twin dhammas of serenity and insight are the Dhamma in the sense of non-excess. They set that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽Purification of virtue is the Dhamma in the sense of restraint. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Avikkhepaṭṭhena cittavisuddhi dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Dassanaṭṭhena diṭṭhivisuddhi dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: avikkhepa ṭṭhena citta visuddhi dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dassana ṭṭhena diṭṭhi visuddhi dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Purification of consciousness is the Dhamma in the sense of non-distraction. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽Purification of view is the Dhamma in the sense of seeing. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Muttaṭṭhena vimokkho dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: mutta ṭṭhena vimokkhaḥ dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Deliverance is the Dhamma in the sense of freedom. It sets that Dhamma going, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Paṭivedhaṭṭhena vijjā dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Pariccāgaṭṭhena vimutti dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Samucchedaṭṭhena khaye ñāṇaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: paṭivedha ṭṭhena vijjā dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  pariccāga ṭṭhena vimutti dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  samuccheda ṭṭhena khaye ñāṇam tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: In the sense of penetration, understanding is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽In the sense of relinquishment, deliverance is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽In the sense of complete destruction, knowledge of destruction is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṭṭhena anuppāde ñāṇaṁ dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddha ṭṭhena anuppāde ñāṇam dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: In the sense of complete tranquillization, knowledge of non-arising is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Chando mūlaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Manasikāro samuṭṭhānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Phasso samodhānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: chandaḥ mūla ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  manasikāraḥ samuṭṭhāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  phassaḥ samodhāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: In the sense of root, will is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽In the sense of origination, attention is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽In the sense of meeting, contact is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Vedanā samosaraṇaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Samādhi pamukhaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: vedanā samosaraṇa ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  samādhi tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: In the sense of meeting together, feeling is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽In the sense of forefront, concentration is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Sati ādhipateyyaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: sati ādhipateyya ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: In the sense of predominance, mindfulness is a state that turns that state, that is, the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Paññā taduttaraṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Vimutti sāraṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: paññā tad uttara ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  vimutti sāraṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: Understanding is the foremost of the states that are ideas. The Dhamma is what sets rolling that understanding. So it is a wheel.🔽Deliverance is the foremost of the states that are ideas. The Dhamma is what sets rolling that deliverance. So it is a wheel.

original: Amatogadhaṁ nibbānaṁ pariyosānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽“Taṁ kho panidaṁ dukkhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ pariññeyyan”ti …pe…
analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  tam kho panidam dukkham ariya saccam pariññeyyanti pe
translated: Extinction of craving is the foremost of the states that are ideas. The Dhamma is what sets rolling that extinction of craving. So it is a wheel.🔽“This Noble Truth of suffering is to be fully known” …🔽“It is fully known” …

original: pariññātanti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: pariññātanti pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: “Eye was born, knowledge was born, wisdom was born, understanding was born, light was born” .

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi  cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: “Eye was born”:

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena pe
translated: in what sense? …

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: “Knowledge was born, wisdom was born, understanding was born, light was born”:

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena
translated: in what sense?

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: “Eye was born”:

analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena pe
translated: in the sense of seeing …

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: “Knowledge was born, wisdom was born, understanding was born, light was born”:

analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena  cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho pe
translated: in the sense of illumination.🔽Eye is the idea; the sense of seeing is the meaning. …

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Light is the idea; the sense of illumination is the meaning.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā dukkhavatthukā saccavatthukā saccārammaṇā saccagocarā saccasaṅgahitā saccapariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā dukkha vatthukā sacca vatthukā sacca ārammaṇā sacca gocarā sacca saṅgahitā sacca pariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā
translated: These five dhammas are five in terms of meaning, but in terms of phrasing they are one. They are based on suffering, based on the noble truths, have the noble truths as their object, the noble truths as their domain, are included in the noble truths, are encompassed by the noble truths, arise together with the noble truths, and are present together with the noble truths.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka  dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: Why is it called the wheel of the Dhamma?🔽It turns the Dhamma and it turns the wheel, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti  dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It turns the wheel and the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It turns by means of the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe
translated: It turns by means of the practice of the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It turns while standing in the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It turns while being established in the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: amatogadhaṁ nibbānaṁ pariyosānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽“Idaṁ dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccan”ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  idam dukkha samudayam ariya saccanti pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: … It turns the Dhamma that has the deathless as its culmination and Nibbāna as its final goal, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽“This is the noble truth of the origin of suffering” — vision arose, knowledge arose, wisdom arose, understanding arose, light arose.🔽“This noble truth of the origin of suffering is to be abandoned” — vision arose, knowledge arose, wisdom arose, understanding arose, light arose.

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi pe
translated: light arose …🔽…

analyzed: tam kho panidam dukkha samudayam ariya saccam pahātabbanti pe
translated: ‘The noble truth of the arising of suffering is to be given up’ …

original: “pahīnan”ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi.
analyzed: pahīnam ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: ‘It has been given up’ …🔽The eye arose …

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: The eye arose …

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena pe
translated: What is the meaning of ‘arose’? …

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: The light arose …

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena  cakkhum udapādi iti  dassana ṭṭhena pe
translated: What is the meaning of ‘arrose’?🔽The eye arose …🔽What is the meaning of ‘arose’? …

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: The light arose …

analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena
translated: What is the meaning of ‘arrose’?

analyzed: cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho pe
translated: The eye is a phenomenon. Seeing is the meaning. …

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: The light is a phenomenon. Illumination is the meaning.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā samudayavatthukā saccavatthukā …pe…
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā samudaya vatthukā sacca vatthukā pe
translated: These five phenomena and five meanings are based on the origin, based on the truth …

analyzed: nirodha vatthukā sacca vatthukā pe
translated: based on the cessation, based on the truth …

original: maggavatthukā saccavatthukā saccārammaṇā saccagocarā saccasaṅgahitā saccapariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: magga vatthukā sacca vatthukā sacca ārammaṇā sacca gocarā sacca saṅgahitā sacca pariyāpannā sacce samudāgatā sacce ṭhitā sacce patiṭṭhitā
translated: based on the path, based on the truth. They’re resolved on the truth, based on the truth, established on the truth.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka
translated: What is the meaning of ‘wheel of the Teaching’?

analyzed: dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: It turns the Teaching and it’s a wheel, thus it’s the wheel of the Teaching.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti
translated: He sets in motion the wheel of the Dhamma and the Dhamma itself: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets in motion the wheel by means of the Dhamma: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽He sets in motion the wheel of the practice of the Dhamma: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe
translated: He sets in motion the wheel while established in the Dhamma: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽He sets in motion the wheel while being established in the Dhamma: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽… He sets in motion the wheel of the Dhamma that has the deathless as its ground, the deathless as its destination, and the deathless as its final goal: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: amatogadhaṁ nibbānaṁ pariyosānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽2.7.2. Satipaṭṭhānavāra
analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  sati paṭṭhāna vāra
translated: … The section on the four foundations of mindfulness🔽“Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This is the development of the observation of a body in the body.’

original: “‘Ayaṁ kāye kāyānupassanā’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi.🔽Sā kho panāyaṁ kāye kāyānupassanā bhāvetabbāti me, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: ayam kāye kāya anupassanā ti me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi  sā kho pana ayam kāye kāya anupassanā bhāvetabbā ati me bhikkhave pe
translated: “Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This observation of a body in the body should be developed.’🔽“Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This observation of a body in the body has been developed.’

original: bhāvitāti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi.🔽Ayaṁ vedanāsu …pe…
analyzed: bhāvitā ati me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi  ayam vedanāsu pe
translated: “Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This is the development of the observation of feelings in feelings.’

analyzed: ayam citte
translated: “Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This observation of feelings in feelings should be developed.’🔽“Monks, the eye arose in me regarding things not heard before. Knowledge arose, insight arose, wisdom arose, and light arose regarding things not heard before: ‘This observation of feelings in feelings has been developed.’

original: ayaṁ dhammesu dhammānupassanāti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi.🔽Sā kho panāyaṁ dhammesu dhammānupassanā bhāvetabbāti me, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: ayam dhammesu dhamma anupassanā ti me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi  sā kho pana ayam dhammesu dhamma anupassanā bhāvetabbā ati me bhikkhave pe
translated: ‘This is contemplation of mental qualities as mental qualities’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.🔽‘This contemplation of mental qualities as mental qualities should be developed’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.

original: bhāvitāti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi”.
analyzed: bhāvitā ati me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: ‘This contemplation of mental qualities as mental qualities has been developed’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.🔽‘This is contemplation of the body as a body’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.

original: “Ayaṁ kāye kāyānupassanā”ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi …pe…🔽sā kho panāyaṁ kāye kāyānupassanā bhāvetabbāti …pe…
analyzed: ayam kāye kāya anupassanā ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi pe  sā kho pana ayam kāye kāya anupassanā bhāvetabbā ati pe
translated: ‘This is contemplation of the body as a body’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.🔽‘This contemplation of the body as a body should be developed’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.

original: bhāvitāti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: bhāvitā ati pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: ‘This contemplation of the body as a body has been developed’—blissful concentration arose in me, and so on as in §11.

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi  cakkhum udapādi iti  kenaṭṭhena pe  ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: ‘Eye arose’—🔽in what sense is it said, ‘Eye arose’?🔽‘Light arose’—

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena
translated: in what sense is it said, ‘Light arose’?

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: ‘Eye arose’—

analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena pe
translated: in the sense of seeing.

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: ‘Light arose’—

analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena  cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho pe
translated: in the sense of illumination.🔽Eye is a phenomenon. The sense of seeing is the meaning.

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Light is a phenomenon. The sense of illumination is the meaning.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā kāyavatthukā satipaṭṭhānavatthukā …pe…
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā kāya vatthukā sati paṭṭhāna vatthukā pe
translated: These five dhammas, which are fivefold, are to be directly known. They are the basis for the establishment of mindfulness, which is why they are called “the establishment of mindfulness.

analyzed: vedanā vatthukā sati paṭṭhāna vatthukā  citta vatthukā sati paṭṭhāna vatthukā
translated: They are the basis for the establishment of mindfulness, which is why they are called “the establishment of mindfulness.🔽They are the basis for the establishment of mindfulness, which is why they are called “the establishment of mindfulness.

analyzed: dhamma vatthukā sati paṭṭhāna vatthukā sati paṭṭhāna ārammaṇā sati paṭṭhāna gocarā sati paṭṭhāna saṅgahitā
translated: They are the object of the establishment of mindfulness, the domain of the establishment of mindfulness, what is to be fully comprehended by the establishment of mindfulness, what is to be fully known by the establishment of mindfulness, what is to be directly known by the establishment of mindfulness, what is to be realized by the establishment of mindfulness.

original: satipaṭṭhānapariyāpannā satipaṭṭhāne samudāgatā satipaṭṭhāne ṭhitā satipaṭṭhāne patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna pariyāpannā sati paṭṭhāne samudāgatā sati paṭṭhāne ṭhitā sati paṭṭhāne patiṭṭhitā
translated: They are included in the establishment of mindfulness, are contained in the establishment of mindfulness, and agree with the establishment of mindfulness.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka  dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: What is the wheel of the Dhamma? In what sense is it called the wheel of the Dhamma?🔽It is the Dhamma and it rolls on, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti  dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It rolls on and it is the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It rolls on by means of the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It rolls on by the practice of the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.🔽It rolls on while established in the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe
translated: It rolls on while based on the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma. …

original: amatogadhaṁ nibbānaṁ pariyosānaṭṭhena dhammo taṁ dhammaṁ pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽2.7.3. Iddhipādavāra
analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammo tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka  iddhipāda vāra
translated: … The section on the basis of success🔽“Monks, the desire, the persistence, the consciousness, and the investigation that are accompanied by the right concentration of one whose view has been fully purified—this is the basis of success.

original: “‘Ayaṁ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo’ti me, bhikkhave pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: ayam chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ ti me bhikkhave pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: Monks, in regard to things unheard before, there arose in me…

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: the light of the Dhamma.

original: ‘So kho panāyaṁ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo bhāvetabbo’ti me, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: saḥ kho pana ayam chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ iti me bhikkhave pe
translated: ‘This basis of success accompanied by desire should be developed’— monks, in regard to this, there arose in me…🔽the light of the Dhamma.

original: bhāvitoti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: bhāvito ti me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: Monks, in regard to things unheard before, there arose in me…

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi  ayam  ayam citta samādhi pe
translated: the light of the Dhamma.🔽The persistence, the consciousness, and the investigation that are accompanied by the right concentration of one whose view has been fully purified—this is the basis of success.

original: ayaṁ vīmaṁsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādoti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: ayam vīmasā samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ ti me bhikkhave pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: Monks, in regard to things unheard before, there arose in me…

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: the light of the Dhamma.

original: So kho panāyaṁ vīmaṁsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo bhāvetabboti me, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: saḥ kho pana ayam vīmasā samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ iti me bhikkhave pe
translated: And as I thus clung to nothing in the world, I perceived that freedom of mind and freedom through intuitive wisdom where all the corruptions fade away.

original: bhāvitoti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi”.
analyzed: bhāvito ti me bhikkhave pubbe an anussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: And I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: “Ayaṁ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo”ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: ayam chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādo ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: “This is the road to psychic power, bhikkhus, that was thus declared by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, and it has been undertaken by me.

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi pe
translated: And as I did so, I did not cling to anything in the world.

original: so kho panāyaṁ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo bhāvetabboti …pe…🔽bhāvitoti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi, ñāṇaṁ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
analyzed: saḥ kho pana ayam chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ iti pe  bhāvito ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi ñāṇam udapādi paññā udapādi vijjā udapādi ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: And as I thus clung to nothing in the world, I perceived that freedom of mind and freedom through intuitive wisdom where all the corruptions fade away.🔽And I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’🔽“This is the road to psychic power, bhikkhus, that was thus declared by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, and it has been undertaken by me.🔽And as I did so, I perceived that freedom of mind and freedom through intuitive wisdom where all the corruptions fade away.

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: And I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena  ñāṇam udapādi iti  kenaṭṭhena  paññā udapādi iti
translated: “What is the eye that arose?🔽What is the knowledge that arose?🔽What is the understanding that arose?

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena  vijjāḥ udapādi iti
translated: What is the clear-seeing that arose?

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena  ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: What is the light that arose?

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena  cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: What is the eye that arose?

analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena
translated: It arose as seeing.

analyzed: ñāṇam udapādi iti
translated: Knowledge arose:

analyzed: ñāta ṭṭhena
translated: in the sense of being known.

analyzed: paññā udapādi iti
translated: Understanding arose:

analyzed: pajānana ṭṭhena
translated: in the sense of understanding.

analyzed: vijjāḥ udapādi iti
translated: Clear-vision arose:

analyzed: paṭivedha ṭṭhena
translated: in the sense of penetration.

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: Light arose:

analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena
translated: in the sense of illumination.

original: Cakkhuṁ dhammo, dassanaṭṭho attho.🔽Ñāṇaṁ dhammo, ñātaṭṭho attho.🔽Paññā dhammo, pajānanaṭṭho attho.
analyzed: cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho  ñāṇam dhammaḥ ñāta ṭṭhaḥ atthaḥ  paññā dhammaḥ pajānanaṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: The eye is the Teaching; the meaning of seeing is the sense.🔽Knowledge is the Teaching; the meaning of being known is the sense.🔽Understanding is the Teaching; the meaning of understanding is the sense.

analyzed: vijjā dhammo paṭivedha aṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Clear-vision is the Teaching; the meaning of penetration is the sense.

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Light is the Teaching; the meaning of illumination is the sense.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā chandavatthukā iddhipādavatthukā iddhipādārammaṇā iddhipādagocarā
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā chanda vatthukā iddhipāda vatthukā iddhipāda ārammaṇā iddhipāda gocarā
translated: These five teachings and five senses are the basis for desire, the basis for energy, the basis for intent, and the basis for investigation. They are the object of the basis for success, the range of the basis for success,

original: iddhipādasaṅgahitā iddhipādapariyāpannā iddhipāde samudāgatā iddhipāde ṭhitā iddhipāde patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: iddhipāda saṅgahitāḥ iddhipāda pariyāpannāḥ iddhipāde samudāgatāḥ iddhipāde ṭhitāḥ iddhipāde patiṭṭhitā
translated: included in the basis for success, contained in the basis for success, arisen from the basis for success, based on the basis for success, established on the basis for success.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka  dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: Why is it called the wheel of the Teaching?🔽It turns the Teaching and the wheel, thus it is the wheel of the Teaching.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti  dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It turns the wheel and the Teaching, thus it is the wheel of the Teaching.🔽It turns by means of the Teaching, thus it is the wheel of the Teaching.

analyzed: dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It turns by means of the practice of the Teaching, thus it is the wheel of the Teaching.

analyzed: dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma.🔽He sets it rolling in the established Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme patiṭṭhāpento pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme vasi patto
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been penetrated.🔽He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been mastered.

original: Dhamme vasiṁ pāpento pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Dhamme pāramippatto pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: dhamme vasim pāpentaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme pārami patto pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the vehicle.🔽He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the basis.

original: Dhamme pāramiṁ pāpento pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ …pe…🔽dhammaṁ apacāyamāno pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: dhamme pāramim pāpentaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe  dhammam apacāyamānaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the foundation.🔽He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the support.

analyzed: dhamma ddhajaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamma ketu pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the standard.🔽He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the banner.

analyzed: dhamma ādhipateyyo pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets it rolling in the Dhamma that has been made the leader.

original: Taṁ kho pana dhammacakkaṁ appaṭivattiyaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasminti—dhammacakkaṁ.
analyzed: tam kho pana dhamma cakkam appaṭivattiyam samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenacid vā lokasmin ti dhammacakka
translated: And that wheel cannot be stopped by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”

analyzed: saddhi indriyam dhammo
translated: “The faith faculty is a state of Dhamma.🔽He sets that Dhamma rolling.”

analyzed: tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe
translated: He sets in motion the Dhamma wheel …

analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammaḥ
translated: Nibbāna, which has the nature of the deathless, is the Dhamma in the sense of conclusion.

analyzed: tam dhammam pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: He sets in motion that Dhamma: thus it is the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: Ayaṁ vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādoti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…
analyzed: ayam vīriya samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādo ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe
translated: This road to power is concentration through energy, accompanied by effort, inspired by the desire: ‘May I come to have supernormal power…

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi pe
translated: Light has arisen…

original: so kho panāyaṁ vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgato iddhipādo bhāvetabboti …pe…
analyzed: saḥ kho pana ayam vīriya samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgataḥ iddhipādaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ ti pe
translated: This road to power is concentration through energy, accompanied by effort, inspired by the desire: ‘May I come to have supernormal power…

original: bhāvitoti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi …pe…🔽āloko udapādi.
analyzed: bhāvito ti pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhum udapādi pe  ālokaḥ udapādi
translated: It has been developed: light has arisen…🔽Light has arisen:

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti  kenaṭṭhena pe
translated: in what sense has light arisen?

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: Light has arisen:

analyzed: kenaṭṭhena
translated: in what sense has light arisen?

analyzed: cakkhum udapādi iti
translated: Light has arisen:

analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena pe
translated: in the sense of seeing…

analyzed: ālokaḥ udapādi iti
translated: Light has arisen:

analyzed: obhā saṭṭhena  cakkhum dhammaḥ dassana aṭṭhaḥ attho pe
translated: in the sense of illumination.🔽The eye is the Dhamma; the sense of seeing is the meaning.

analyzed: ālokaḥ dhammaḥ obhā saṭṭhaḥ attho
translated: Light is the Dhamma; the sense of illumination is the meaning.

original: Ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā vīriyavatthukā iddhipādavatthukā …pe…
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā pañca atthā vīriya vatthukā iddhipāda vatthukā pe
translated: These five dhammas, five meanings, based upon energy, based upon the road to power,

analyzed: citta vatthukā iddhipāda vatthukā
translated: based upon consciousness, based upon the road to power,

original: vīmaṁsāvatthukā iddhipādavatthukā iddhipādārammaṇā iddhipādagocarā iddhipādasaṅgahitā iddhipādapariyāpannā iddhipāde samudāgatā iddhipāde ṭhitā iddhipāde patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vīmasā vatthukā iddhipāda vatthukā iddhipāda ārammaṇā iddhipāda gocarā iddhipāda saṅgahitā iddhipāda pariyāpannā iddhipāde samudāgatā iddhipāde ṭhitā iddhipāde patiṭṭhitā
translated: They are based on investigation, based on the basis of spiritual power, have the basis of spiritual power as their object, are the domain of the basis of spiritual power, are included in the basis of spiritual power, are classed as the basis of spiritual power, have arisen from the basis of spiritual power, are based on the basis of spiritual power, and are established on the basis of spiritual power.

analyzed: dhammacakkanti kenaṭṭhena dhammacakka  dhammañca pavatta iti cakkañca ati dhamma cakka
translated: Why is it called the wheel of Dhamma?🔽It sets the Dhamma in motion and it is a wheel, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.

analyzed: cakkañca pavatta iti  dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakka
translated: It sets the wheel in motion and it is the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.🔽It sets the Dhamma in motion, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.

original: Dhammacariyāya pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Dhamme ṭhito pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ.🔽Dhamme patiṭṭhito pavattetīti—dhammacakkaṁ …pe…
analyzed: dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme ṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakka  dhamme patiṭṭhitaḥ pavatteti iti dhammacakkam pe
translated: It sets the practice of the Dhamma in motion, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.🔽It sets the Dhamma in motion by being based on the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.🔽It sets the Dhamma in motion by being established on the Dhamma, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.

analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena dhammaḥ
translated: … It has the deathless as its culmination, Nibbāna as its conclusion, thus it is the Dhamma.

analyzed: tam dhammam
translated: It sets that Dhamma in motion, thus it is the wheel of Dhamma.

analyzed: dhammacakka kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the wheel of Dhamma is finished.
